I just noticed your question about getting html pages only. This informatio=
n should help:
http://web.archive.org/web/20071218182807/http://www.dreamer=
srealm.net/~tree/blog/?s=3Dtext/html&submit=3DGO

Regarding the artists cra=
wl,  did you try putting the MatchesRegExpDecideRule in the Archiver proces=
sor set of decide rules? That way your crawler will still look at other pag=
es for links, but only write the ones that match the /show/artist pattern?
=

Lauren

________________________________________
From: archive-crawler@yah=
oogroups.com [archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Eric Pugh [epug=
h@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 30, 2009 10:03 AM
To: ar=
chive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Filtering what=
 is indexed based on URL's...

When I paste in this string:

^http://www.my=
site.com/show/artist.*$

as the regex, it seems to prevent my initial seed =
page of
http://www.mysite.com/browseartists.html from being crawled...

Is =
there a simpler approach, like "any url that matches this Glob pattern?" an=
d provide a couple of globs patterns to use?

Eric


On Apr 29, 2009, at 2:=
43 PM, Ko, Lauren wrote:




Hi Eric,
You might want to read here: http://c=
rawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/glossary.html#surtprefix. If you ar=
e using the SurtPrefixedDecideRule, to get to the SURT prefix when there ar=
e 3 or more slashes in the URL, everything after the last slash is truncate=
d. You could try using a MatchesRegExpDecideRule instead to match the patte=
rn ^http://www.mysite.com/show/artist.*$ instead.

Lauren Ko
Web Archiving =
Programmer
Digital Projects Unit
University of North Texas

ler%40yahoogroups.com>
Subject: [archive-crawler] Filtering what is indexed=
 based on URL's...

I am searching a site and I want to limit it to just a =
subset of urls
that match the pattern /show/artist. Right now it crawls any=
thing.

I thought SURT logic would do it, but it doesn't seem to parse belo=
w
the www.mysite.com<http://www.mysite.com> level of a URL... Or am I under=
standing SURT
wrong? My SURT patterns were just done by pasting in a full U=
RL and
seeing what came out.

Also, how would I filter archiving of images,=
 css, etc.. I only want
HTML pages.

I am using Heretrix 2.0 (and quite lik=
ing it!)

Eric
